intro: Sinapis arvensis var. vera, commonly known as field mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with serrated leaves and a robust root system. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Its seeds are small and can remain viable in the soil for several years, contributing to its invasive potential in certain regions.
